Merge pull request #20 from fferrari/patch-2

Update maqmap.c

Update maqmap.c

In the previous edit the exit(3) statement was replaced with a return, to comply with R CRAN requirements that the calls to C subroutines should never be able to cause R termination with exit.

Here I'm replacing return 0 with return 3 to have a return value equal to the previous exit code, although this does not seem to be handled by upstream C++ code calling this subroutine

Merge pull request #16 from koustav-pal/development

Changes to multiple files. See body for details.

Changes to multiple files. See body for details.
All changes in these commits have been made to pass CRAN checks.

- The DESCRIPTION file, now will check for Rcpp through the Depends tag,
  the methods package has been added to pass one Note which was issued
  in relation to its Usage.
- The NAMESPACE has now been changed so as not to export all functions.
  But specific functions are now imported. This file needs more
  modifications to include all public functions in SPP. Conflicting R
  closure functions are now explicitly registered as S3 methods.
  Note the usage of three param declaration in 'S3method' methods.
  The first is the name of the function, the second is the parent class
  and third is the optional name of the method within the class. This
  defaults to method.class if left blank.
- zroutines.R, the file containing all the R functions now has a
  dummy S4 class declared at the start. All CRAN conflicting functions
  of type closure are now declared as members of the dummy class
  "SPPGenerics". .Call calls to lwcc and wtd C functions has been changed
  to spp_lwcc and spp_wtd.
- configure.ac now has multiple flags being set and also performs a check
  for SH libs. We must remove this later as it is not required.
- Makevars.in, D_FASTMAP and DMAQ_LONGREADS have been removed.
- bed2vector.cpp. cerr has been converted to REprintf and couts have been
  changed to Rprintf
- fprintf has been changed to R/REprintf. Presence of exit in the file
  produces a WARNING during check. Some blogs note that return 0 will
  produce a similar effect. This converted the R warning regarding the
  usage of output streams outside the scope of R into a NOTE.
- maqread.cpp, cout converted to Rprintf.
- spp_init.c, has been created as its absence caused a WARNING for dynlib
  loading. Afterwards this lead to a conflict between pre-registered
  symbols in R and CPP. The functions in question are lwcc and wtd. So
  lwcc and wtd in this scope have been converted into spp_lwcc and
  spp_wtd.
- wdl.cpp, here lwcc and wtd have been changed to their corresponding
  spp_ versions.
Fixed the whs check in get.binding.characteristics to avoid a TRUE with numeric

Improve DESCRIPTION file
DESCRIPTION: Add a description
DESCRIPTION: Add a title
DESCRIPTION: Add space between name and email address

DESCRIPTION: Remove DOS/Windows line-ending characters [1]

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64749/m-character-at-end-of-lines

README: Mark up the environment variable `BOOST_ROOT`

Now, the underscore doesn’t need to be escaped anymore.
README: Add missing indefinite article

README: Use HTTPS URL scheme for Boost Web site

It currently redirects to the non-secure connection, but make it future
proof already, once the Boost project decides to join the present, and
offer a secure way to access their Web site.

```
$ curl -I https://www.boost.org/
HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Date: Thu, 15 Sep 2016 13:34:02 GMT
Server: Apache/2.2.15 (Red Hat)
Location: http://www.boost.org/
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/html; charset=iso-8859-1

```
README: Link to R Web site

README: Correctly escape underscore (_)

The underscore (_) is a special keyword in Markdown. So escape it.
README: Strip trailing space
